visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column with overlaid pie charts. Chart title: 'Series on point'. Axes and labels styling: Use a dark gray color (#333) for all text, with a font size of 14px. Data series: The first series is a column chart with data points [3, 5, 5, 3, 2, 3], each with an id. The second, third, and fourth series are pie charts that are displayed over specific points with ids 'firstPoint', 'secondPoint', and 'thirdPoint', respectively. Custom colors: Use a specific list of colors for the pie charts: ['#008000', '#FFA500', '#FF0000']. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to light gray (#f0f0f0), add a legend at the bottom of the chart, and set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.

subtitle.text: Pies displayed over points with a given id

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart with overlaid pie charts. The main column series contains data points with specific ids, which are used to position the pie charts. The pie charts are styled with custom colors and positioned over the corresponding points in the column chart. The chart title and subtitle are styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 14px. The axes labels and titles also follow this styling. The chart background is set to light gray, and a legend is placed at the bottom of the chart. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to provide adequate spacing around the chart.
